page.title: 04COUNTY EDUCATION:WOKINGHAM
page.content: {Hatch Ride County Primary This is a one form entry, open-plan, Joint-Venture school.The main part of the school is owned and maintained by Berkshire County Council. The hall is larger than usual the stage forming the Parish rooms;the kitchen and toilets are also owned by the Parish. in the day the school has full use of the hall. After 6p.m. the hall is under the lien of the Parish and is used for social occasions. School meals are transported from nearby Oaklands School;costs are 65p. for a main meal,55p. for a snack(free meals for low income families). There is no uniform but children are asked to wear the school colours of red and navy. The cost of educating a child in a Berkshire school is 75p. per morning or afternoon session and is borne by the County Council.
